ingredients: 1 lb pork shoulder, cut into chunks
Brazilian.cooking_instructions: Cook beans until tender. Brown all meats separately. Add onions and garlic, cook until soft. Add meats to beans with seasonings. Simmer for 2 hours until tender. Serve with rice and orange slices.

Dissolve yeast in warm water with sugar. Mix flour, salt, butter, eggs, and milk. Add yeast mixture and knead until smooth. Let rise for 1 hour. Shape into rolls and let rise again. Bake at 375°F for 20 minutes. Brush with melted butter and sprinkle with sugar.

Mix condensed milk, cocoa powder, and butter in saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and pulls away from pan. Remove from heat and add vanilla. Let cool completely. Roll into balls and coat with sprinkles. Chill before serving.

Marinate fish with lime juice, garlic, and seasonings for 30 minutes. Heat palm oil and cook onions and peppers until soft. Add tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes. Add fish and coconut milk. Simmer for 15 minutes until fish is cooked. Garnish with cilantro and serve with rice.
Blend açaí puree with banana until smooth. Pour into bowl. Top with granola, berries, chia seeds, and coconut flakes. Drizzle with honey and almond butter. Serve immediately.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Mix olive oil with garlic, herbs, salt, and pepper. Rub mixture over all meats. Grill over medium heat, turning frequently, until cooked through. Serve with chimichurri sauce.

Make dough with flour, lard, water, and salt. Let rest for 30 minutes. Brown ground beef with onion and garlic. Add spices and cook for 10 minutes. Add eggs and olives. Roll dough and cut into circles. Fill with meat mixture and seal. Bake at 375°F for 25 minutes until golden.

Remove label from can and place in large pot. Cover with water and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 3 hours, adding water as needed. Let cool completely before opening. Mix with vanilla extract. Serve as spread or filling.
Chop parsley, cilantro, and garlic finely. Mix with vinegar, oil, and seasonings. Let sit for 30 minutes to blend flavors. Serve with grilled meats.

Mix flour, cornstarch, sugar, butter, egg yolks, vanilla, baking powder, and salt. Knead until smooth. Roll out and cut into circles. Bake at 350°F for 12 minutes. Cool completely. Spread dulce de leche between two cookies. Dust with powdered sugar.
Mix chicken with cream cheese and seasonings. Shape into small balls. Coat with flour, egg, and breadcrumbs. Fry until golden and crispy.
Argentine.chef_tips: Make bite-sized portions for kids. Use lean chicken breast. Perfect Brazilian comfort food for lunch boxes.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange in bento box with Brazilian flag toothpicks for fun.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Blend açaí with plant milk until smooth. Pour into bowl. Top with banana, granola, coconut, chia seeds, and honey.
Argentine.chef_tips: Use frozen açaí for thick consistency. Add colorful fruits for appeal. Perfect for plant-based kids.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in insulated container to keep cold. Add toppings separately to maintain texture.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Mix dry ingredients. Add wet ingredients and mix until combined. Shape into small balls. Bake at 375°F for 12-15 minutes until golden.
Argentine.chef_tips: Use coconut oil for authentic flavor. Perfect for lactose-intolerant kids. Great Brazilian snack.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange in bento box with fresh fruit on the side.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Cook quinoa according to package directions. Mix with ground beef, onions, and seasonings. Shape into small patties. Cook in oiled skillet until golden.
Argentine.chef_tips: Use quinoa instead of bulgur for gluten-free version. Perfect for gluten-sensitive kids. Great protein source.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange patties in bento box with Brazilian-style sides.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Heat condensed milk, cocoa powder, and coconut oil in saucepan. Cook until thickened. Let cool. Roll into small balls and coat with sprinkles.
Argentine.chef_tips: Use dairy-free condensed milk for vegan version. Perfect for egg-allergic kids. Classic Brazilian treat.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange in small paper cups in bento box.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Blend lime juice, coconut water, stevia, and ice until smooth. Add mint and sparkling water. Serve immediately.
Argentine.chef_tips: Use fresh lime juice for best flavor. Perfect for low-carb diets. Refreshing Brazilian drink.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in insulated bottle to keep cold.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Heat oil in pot. Add rice and cook until translucent. Add vegetables, seasonings, and broth. Simmer until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed.
Argentine.chef_tips: Use kosher-certified ingredients. Perfect for kosher-observant families. Classic Brazilian side dish.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in thermos to keep warm. Serve with protein on the side.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Season chicken with spices. Heat oil in skillet. Cook chicken with vegetables until golden and cooked through. Serve with rice.
Argentine.chef_tips: Ensure all ingredients are halal-certified. Perfect for halal-observant families. Great protein source.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange chicken and vegetables in bento box with rice.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Blend açaí, banana, coconut milk, honey, and ice until smooth. Add vanilla extract. Serve immediately.
Argentine.chef_tips: Use frozen açaí for thick consistency. Perfect for nut-allergic kids. Great energy boost.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in insulated bottle to keep cold.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Mix all ingredients until combined. Shape into small balls. Bake at 375°F for 12-15 minutes until golden and puffed.
Argentine.chef_tips: Use tapioca flour for authentic texture. Perfect for keto-friendly kids. Classic Brazilian snack.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange in bento box with fresh fruit.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Season fish with spices. Heat oil in skillet. Cook fish with vegetables until golden and cooked through. Drizzle with lemon juice.
Argentine.chef_tips: Use fresh fish for best flavor. Perfect for paleo-friendly kids. Great protein source.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange fish and vegetables in bento box with paleo sides.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Heat oil in pot. Add onions and cook until soft. Add beans, seasonings, and broth. Simmer for 10 minutes until flavors combine.
Argentine.chef_tips: Use cooked beans for quick preparation. Perfect for plant-based kids. Classic Brazilian side dish.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in thermos to keep warm. Serve with rice.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Mix dry ingredients. Add wet ingredients and mix until smooth. Cook pancakes in oiled skillet until golden on both sides.
Argentine.chef_tips: Use gluten-free flour blend. Perfect for gluten-sensitive kids. Great breakfast or snack.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange pancakes in bento box with honey on the side.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Whisk coconut milk, cornstarch, sugar, and salt in saucepan. Cook over medium heat, whisking constantly, until thickened. Add vanilla and coconut flakes.
Argentine.chef_tips: Use full-fat coconut milk for creaminess. Perfect for dairy-free kids. Classic Brazilian dessert.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in small container. Top with coconut flakes before serving.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Mix dry ingredients. Add wet ingredients and mix until combined. Fold in corn kernels. Pour into pan and bake at 375°F for 15-18 minutes.
Argentine.chef_tips: Use applesauce instead of eggs. Perfect for egg-allergic kids. Great Brazilian side dish.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Cut into squares and arrange in bento box.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Heat oil in skillet. Add onions and cook until soft. Add cauliflower rice and seasonings. Cook for 5-7 minutes until tender. Garnish with cilantro.
Argentine.chef_tips: Use fresh or frozen cauliflower rice. Perfect for low-carb diets. Great Brazilian side dish.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in thermos to keep warm. Serve with protein on the side.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Heat oil in pot. Add vegetables and cook until soft. Add seasonings and broth. Simmer for 10-15 minutes until tender.
Argentine.chef_tips: Use kosher-certified ingredients. Perfect for kosher-observant families. Great vegetable dish.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in thermos to keep warm. Serve with rice.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Thread chicken and vegetables onto skewers. Brush with oil and seasonings. Grill for 8-10 minutes, turning occasionally, until chicken is cooked through.
Argentine.chef_tips: Ensure all ingredients are halal-certified. Perfect for halal-observant families. Great protein source.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange skewers in bento box with Brazilian sides.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Process all ingredients in food processor until combined. Roll into small balls. Refrigerate for 30 minutes to firm up.
Argentine.chef_tips: Use sunflower seed butter instead of nut butter. Perfect for nut-allergic kids. Great energy boost.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange energy balls in bento box with fresh fruit.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Mix cheese, almond flour, egg, and seasonings. Shape into sticks. Bake at 400°F for 8-10 minutes until golden and crispy.
Argentine.chef_tips: Use almond flour for keto-friendly version. Perfect for keto-friendly kids. High in protein and low in carbs.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange sticks in bento box with low-carb vegetables.

ingredients: 3 oz white fish fillet, cooked and flaked (90g)
Argentine.cooking_instructions: Mix fish with almond flour, egg, and seasonings. Shape into small patties. Cook in oiled skillet until golden on both sides.
Argentine.chef_tips: Use fresh fish for best flavor. Perfect for paleo-friendly kids. Great protein source.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange patties in bento box with paleo sides.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Heat oil in pot. Add onions and carrots, cook until soft. Add beans, seasonings, and broth. Simmer for 10-15 minutes until flavors combine.
Argentine.chef_tips: Use cooked beans for quick preparation. Perfect for plant-based kids. Classic Brazilian comfort food.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in thermos to keep warm. Serve with rice.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Mix dry ingredients. Add wet ingredients and mix until combined. Fold in corn kernels. Pour into muffin tin. Bake at 375°F for 15-18 minutes.
Argentine.chef_tips: Use gluten-free flour blend. Perfect for gluten-sensitive kids. Great Brazilian side dish.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange muffins in bento box with fresh fruit.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Heat coconut oil in pot. Add rice and cook until translucent. Add coconut milk, water, and salt. Simmer until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed. Top with coconut flakes.
Argentine.chef_tips: Use full-fat coconut milk for creaminess. Perfect for dairy-free kids. Classic Brazilian side dish.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in thermos to keep warm. Serve with protein on the side.

Argentine.cooking_instructions: Mix dry ingredients. Add wet ingredients and mix until combined. Pour into pan. Bake at 375°F for 15-18 minutes until golden.
Argentine.chef_tips: Use applesauce instead of eggs. Perfect for egg-allergic kids. Great Brazilian snack.
Argentine.lunchbox_presentation: Cut into squares and arrange in bento box.

Peruvian.cooking_instructions: Marinate fish in lime and orange juice for 30 minutes. Add onion, jalapeños, salt, and pepper. Mix well and chill for 1 hour. Serve with sweet potato, corn, and lettuce leaves.

Heat oil in large skillet. Cook beef until browned. Add onions, tomatoes, jalapeños, and garlic. Cook for 5 minutes. Add soy sauce, vinegar, and seasonings. Cook for 5 minutes more. Serve with French fries and rice.

ingredients: 2 lbs chicken breast, cooked and shredded
Peruvian.cooking_instructions: Heat oil and cook onions, garlic, and jalapeños until soft. Add walnuts, cheese, stock, and cream. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add chicken and turmeric. Simmer for 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with rice and olives.

ingredients: 2 lbs beef heart, cut into cubes
Peruvian.cooking_instructions: Marinate beef heart in vinegar, aji pastes, garlic, and seasonings for 2 hours. Thread onto skewers. Grill over medium heat, turning frequently, until cooked through. Serve with grilled corn.
Shake Pisco, lime juice, simple syrup, and egg white with ice. Strain into glass. Add bitters on top. Serve immediately.

Colombian.cooking_instructions: Cook beans until tender. Brown ground beef with onion, garlic, and seasonings. Cook chorizo and pork belly separately. Fry eggs sunny-side up. Fry plantains until golden. Arrange all components on large platter. Serve immediately.
Mix cornmeal with warm water and salt. Let rest for 5 minutes. Add butter and cheese. Form into patties. Cook in oil until golden on both sides. Serve warm.

Brown all meats in large pot. Add onions, garlic, and tomatoes. Cook until soft. Add water and seasonings. Simmer for 1 hour. Add vegetables and simmer for 30 minutes. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.

Make dough with flour, lard, water, and salt. Let rest for 30 minutes. Brown ground beef with onion and garlic. Add spices and cook for 10 minutes. Add eggs and olives. Roll dough and cut into circles. Fill with meat mixture and seal. Fry in hot oil until golden.

Brown chicken in large pot. Add onions, garlic, and tomatoes. Cook until soft. Add stock and seasonings. Simmer for 1 hour. Add vegetables and simmer for 30 minutes. Garnish with cilantro and serve with avocado and sour cream.
Blend açaí puree with banana until smooth. Pour into bowl. Top with granola, berries, coconut flakes, and chia seeds. Drizzle with honey. Serve immediately.
Blend all ingredients until smooth. Pour into mini muffin tins. Bake at 400°F for 15-20 minutes until golden. Serve warm.
Cook beef with onion and garlic until browned. Add spices and season with salt and pepper. Fill dough circles with mixture. Seal edges and bake at 375°F for 20 minutes until golden.

ingredients: Sweet potato and corn for serving
Colombian.cooking_instructions: Marinate fish in lime juice for 10 minutes. Add onion, jalapeños, cilantro, and salt. Mix well. Serve with sweet potato and corn.
Cook quinoa according to package directions. Steam sweet potato until tender. Mix quinoa with sweet potato, corn, black beans, and avocado. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle cumin and salt.
Colombian.chef_tips: Use pre-cooked quinoa for quick prep. Perfect vegetarian lunch for kids. Great Peruvian flavors.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in airtight container. Serve with fresh fruit on the side.

Colombian.cooking_instructions: Thread chicken, peppers, and tomatoes onto skewers. Brush with olive oil and season with cumin, paprika, and salt. Grill for 8-10 minutes until chicken is cooked.
Colombian.chef_tips: Use wooden skewers soaked in water. Perfect protein for kids. Great Peruvian flavors.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange skewers in bento box with quinoa.

Colombian.cooking_instructions: Mix cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, and corn in bowl. Add lime juice, olive oil, cumin, and salt. Toss to combine and let marinate for 5 minutes.
Colombian.chef_tips: Use fresh vegetables for best flavor. Perfect vegan lunch for kids. Great Peruvian flavors.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in airtight container. Serve with sweet potato on the side.

Colombian.cooking_instructions: Thread fish, peppers, and tomatoes onto skewers. Brush with olive oil and season with cumin, paprika, and salt. Grill for 8-10 minutes until fish is cooked.
Colombian.chef_tips: Use firm white fish like cod or haddock. Perfect protein for kids. Great Peruvian flavors.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange skewers in bento box with quinoa.

Colombian.cooking_instructions: Spread hummus on tortilla. Add sweet potato, corn, lettuce, and black beans. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle cumin. Roll tightly and slice in half.
Colombian.chef_tips: Use whole wheat tortilla for extra fiber. Perfect vegetarian lunch for kids. Great Peruvian flavors.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Wrap in foil to keep fresh. Serve with fresh fruit on the side.

Colombian.chef_tips: Use grilled chicken for best flavor. Perfect protein lunch for kids. Great Peruvian flavors.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in airtight container. Serve with fresh fruit on the side.

Colombian.chef_tips: Use brown rice for extra fiber. Perfect vegan lunch for kids. Great Peruvian flavors.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in airtight container. Serve with fresh fruit on the side.

Colombian.chef_tips: Use grilled fish for best flavor. Perfect protein lunch for kids. Great Peruvian flavors.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in airtight container. Serve with fresh fruit on the side.

Colombian.chef_tips: Use whole wheat pita for extra fiber. Perfect vegetarian lunch for kids. Great Peruvian flavors.

Colombian.chef_tips: Use whole wheat pasta for extra fiber. Perfect vegetarian lunch for kids. Great Peruvian flavors.

Colombian.chef_tips: Use short-grain rice for better binding. Perfect vegetarian snack for kids. Great Peruvian flavors.

Colombian.chef_tips: Use short-grain rice for better binding. Perfect protein snack for kids. Great Peruvian flavors.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange rice balls in bento box with fresh vegetables.

Colombian.chef_tips: Use whole wheat bread for extra fiber. Perfect vegetarian lunch for kids. Great Peruvian flavors.

Colombian.chef_tips: Use short-grain rice for better binding. Perfect protein snack for kids. Great Peruvian flavors.

Colombian.cooking_instructions: Mix flour with water and salt. Knead until smooth. Form into patties. Cook in butter for 5 minutes per side. Fill with cheese and serve hot.
Cook hot dogs. Toast buns. Spread mashed avocado on buns. Add hot dogs, tomatoes, sauerkraut, mayonnaise, and mustard. Serve immediately.

ingredients: Shredded chicken and cheese for filling
Colombian.cooking_instructions: Mix cornmeal with water and salt. Let rest for 5 minutes. Form into patties. Cook in oil for 5 minutes per side. Split and fill with chicken and cheese.
Grill corn until charred. Mix mayonnaise and sour cream. Brush corn with mixture. Sprinkle with cheese, chili powder, and lime juice. Garnish with cilantro.
Spread mustard on bread. Layer pork, ham, cheese, and pickles. Butter outside of bread. Press in panini press for 5 minutes until golden and cheese melts.
Fry plantains until golden. Mash with garlic, olive oil, and cracklings. Season with salt. Form into balls and serve hot.
Blend all ingredients until smooth. Pour into mini muffin tins. Bake at 400°F for 15 minutes until golden. Serve warm.
Chop herbs and garlic finely. Mix with vinegar, oil, salt, and pepper. Let sit for 10 minutes. Serve with grilled meats.
Cook beef until browned. Add onion, tomatoes, and garlic. Cook for 5 minutes. Add soy sauce, vinegar, and cumin. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with rice.
Brown meats in pot. Add onion and garlic. Cook for 3 minutes. Add potatoes, yams, and spices. Simmer for 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Cook beef with onion and garlic until browned. Add spices and season with salt and pepper. Fill dough circles with mixture. Seal and bake at 375°F for 20 minutes.
Blend corn with milk, egg, and salt. Heat oil in pan. Pour batter and cook for 3 minutes per side. Top with cheese and serve hot.
Mix shrimp with onion, tomatoes, lime juice, cilantro, and salt. Let sit for 10 minutes. Serve with tortilla chips.
Cook beef with onion and garlic until browned. Add spices and season with salt and pepper. Fill dough circles with mixture. Seal and bake at 375°F for 20 minutes.
Mix flour with milk, oil, egg, and salt. Add cheese. Form into balls. Bake at 400°F for 15 minutes until golden. Serve warm.
Season steaks with salt and pepper. Cook for 4 minutes per side. Toast buns. Layer steak, ham, cheese, tomato, and lettuce. Spread mayonnaise. Serve hot.
Blend tomatoes, onion, and garlic. Cook chicken until browned. Add blended mixture and spices. Simmer for 15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Warm tortillas. Spread with beans. Top with cheese, sour cream, and avocado. Fold in half and serve hot.
Heat oil and cook onion and garlic until soft. Add rice, beans, and cumin. Cook for 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.
Season chicken with salt and pepper. Cook in oil for 8 minutes. Fry plantain until golden. Serve chicken with rice, beans, and plantain.
Brown chicken in pot. Add onion and garlic. Cook for 3 minutes. Add potatoes, yam, and cumin. Simmer for 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Season ground beef with taco seasoning and salt. Heat olive oil and cook beef until golden. Warm tortillas. Fill with beef, tomatoes, lettuce, and cheese. Fold into small tacos.
Colombian.chef_tips: Make bite-sized tacos for kids. Use mild seasoning. Perfect Mexican comfort food for lunch boxes.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange mini tacos in bento box with salsa on the side.

Colombian.cooking_instructions: Heat olive oil and add vegetables. Add rice and cumin. Add broth and simmer until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed. Season with salt and chili powder.
Colombian.chef_tips: Use mild chili powder for kids. Perfect for plant-based kids. Classic Mexican comfort food.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in thermos to keep warm. Serve with fresh vegetables.

Colombian.cooking_instructions: Heat olive oil and add vegetables. Add black beans and cumin. Season with salt and chili powder. Simmer for 10-15 minutes until tender.
Colombian.chef_tips: Use mild chili powder for kids. Perfect for lactose-intolerant kids. Great Mexican comfort food.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in thermos to keep warm. Serve with rice.

Colombian.cooking_instructions: Mix flour, milk, applesauce, olive oil, salt, sugar, and cumin. Make small pancakes in skillet until golden on both sides.
Colombian.chef_tips: Use applesauce instead of eggs. Perfect for egg-allergic kids. Great Mexican breakfast.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange pancakes in bento box with fresh fruit.

Colombian.cooking_instructions: Cook rice according to package directions. Heat olive oil and add vegetables. Add rice and cumin. Season with salt and chili powder.
Colombian.chef_tips: Use gluten-free rice. Perfect for gluten-sensitive kids. Great Mexican side dish.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in thermos to keep warm. Serve with protein on the side.

Colombian.cooking_instructions: Heat olive oil and add vegetables. Add cauliflower rice and cumin. Season with salt and chili powder. Cook for 5-7 minutes until tender.
Colombian.chef_tips: Use fresh or frozen cauliflower rice. Perfect for low-carb diets. Great Mexican side dish.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in thermos to keep warm. Serve with protein on the side.

Colombian.cooking_instructions: Heat kosher olive oil and add vegetables. Add kosher cumin and salt. Add kosher chili powder and broth. Simmer for 10-15 minutes until tender.
Colombian.chef_tips: Use kosher-certified ingredients. Perfect for kosher-observant families. Great Mexican comfort food.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in thermos to keep warm. Serve with rice.

Colombian.cooking_instructions: Season chicken with salt. Heat halal olive oil and cook chicken until golden. Add vegetables and cook until soft. Add halal cumin, halal chili powder, and broth. Simmer for 10-15 minutes until tender.
Colombian.chef_tips: Ensure all ingredients are halal-certified. Perfect for halal-observant families. Great protein stew.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in thermos to keep warm. Serve with rice.

Colombian.cooking_instructions: Process all ingredients in food processor until combined. Roll into small balls. Refrigerate for 30 minutes to firm up.
Colombian.chef_tips: Use sunflower seed butter instead of nut butter. Perfect for nut-allergic kids. Great energy boost.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange energy balls in bento box with fresh fruit.

Colombian.cooking_instructions: Heat olive oil and add vegetables. Add cauliflower rice and cumin. Season with salt and chili powder. Cook for 5-7 minutes until tender.
Colombian.chef_tips: Use fresh or frozen cauliflower rice. Perfect for keto-friendly kids. Great low-carb dish.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in thermos to keep warm. Serve with protein on the side.

Colombian.cooking_instructions: Season fish with salt. Heat coconut oil and cook fish until golden. Add vegetables and cook until soft. Add paleo cumin and broth. Simmer for 10-15 minutes until tender.
Colombian.chef_tips: Use coconut oil for paleo-friendly version. Perfect for paleo-friendly kids. Great protein stew.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in thermos to keep warm. Serve with paleo sides.

Colombian.cooking_instructions: Heat olive oil and add mushrooms and vegetables, cook until soft. Add vegan cumin and salt. Add broth and simmer for 10-15 minutes until tender.
Colombian.chef_tips: Use fresh mushrooms for best flavor. Perfect for plant-based kids. Great protein stew.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in thermos to keep warm. Serve with rice.

Colombian.cooking_instructions: Mix dry ingredients. Add wet ingredients and mix until combined. Pour into muffin tin. Bake at 375°F for 15-18 minutes.
Colombian.chef_tips: Use gluten-free flour blend. Perfect for gluten-sensitive kids. Great Mexican side dish.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange muffins in bento box with fresh fruit.

Colombian.cooking_instructions: Heat coconut oil and add rice. Add coconut milk, water, and salt. Simmer until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed. Sprinkle with cumin.
Colombian.chef_tips: Use full-fat coconut milk for creaminess. Perfect for dairy-free kids. Great Mexican side dish.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in thermos to keep warm. Serve with protein on the side.

Colombian.cooking_instructions: Mix dry ingredients. Add wet ingredients and mix until combined. Pour into pan. Bake at 375°F for 15-18 minutes until golden.
Colombian.chef_tips: Use applesauce instead of eggs. Perfect for egg-allergic kids. Great Mexican snack.
Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Cut into squares and arrange in bento box.

Colombian.cooking_instructions: Heat olive oil and add zucchini noodles. Add vegetables and cumin. Season with salt and chili powder. Cook for 5-7 minutes until tender.

Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in thermos to keep warm. Serve with protein on the side.

Colombian.lunchbox_presentation: Pack in thermos to keep warm. Serve with protein on the side.
